Shift Time Stamp

Shift time stamps in ts-boxable time series. Unlike ts_lag this does not ensure regularity and also works with irregular series.

ts_shift(x, by = NULL)

Arguments

x

ts-boxable time series, an object of class ts, xts, data.frame, data.table, or tibble.
by

passed on to base::seq.Date(). Argument can be specified in several ways: - A number, taken to be in days. - A object of class difftime - A character string, containing one of "day", "week", "month", "quarter" or "year". This can optionally be preceded by a (positive or negative) integer and a space, or followed by "s".

Value

a ts-boxable time series, with the same class as the input. If time stamp shifting causes the object to be irregular, a data frame is returned.

See also

ts_lag(), for shifting regular series. time_shift(), for shifting Date vectors.

Examples

ts_shift(AirPassengers, "1 month")
#>      Jan Feb Mar Apr May Jun Jul Aug Sep Oct Nov Dec
#> 1949     112 118 132 129 121 135 148 148 136 119 104
#> 1950 118 115 126 141 135 125 149 170 170 158 133 114
#> 1951 140 145 150 178 163 172 178 199 199 184 162 146
#> 1952 166 171 180 193 181 183 218 230 242 209 191 172
#> 1953 194 196 196 236 235 229 243 264 272 237 211 180
#> 1954 201 204 188 235 227 234 264 302 293 259 229 203
#> 1955 229 242 233 267 269 270 315 364 347 312 274 237
#> 1956 278 284 277 317 313 318 374 413 405 355 306 271
#> 1957 306 315 301 356 348 355 422 465 467 404 347 305
#> 1958 336 340 318 362 348 363 435 491 505 404 359 310
#> 1959 337 360 342 406 396 420 472 548 559 463 407 362
#> 1960 405 417 391 419 461 472 535 622 606 508 461 390
#> 1961 432                                            
ts_shift(AirPassengers, 3)
